user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex:
```c
int32 OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t object_id, osal_index_t *ArrayIndex)
{
    uint32         max_id;
    uint32         obj_index;
    osal_objtype_t actual_type;
    int32          return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(ArrayIndex);

    obj_index   = OS_ObjectIdToSerialNumber_Impl(object_id);
    actual_type = OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(object_id);

    /*
     * If requested by the caller, enforce that the ID is of the correct type.
     * If the caller passed OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED, then anything is allowed.
     */
    if (idtype != OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED && actual_type != idtype)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERR_INVALID_ID;
    }
    else
    {
        max_id = OS_GetMaxForObjectType(actual_type);
        if (max_id == 0)
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INVALID_ID;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
            *ArrayIndex = OSAL_INDEX_C(obj_index % max_id);
        }
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
static inline uint32 OS_ObjectIdToSerialNumber_Impl(osal_id_t id)
{
    return (OS_ObjectIdToInteger(id) & OS_OBJECT_INDEX_MASK);
}
...
static inline osal_objtype_t OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(osal_id_t id)
{
    return (OS_ObjectIdToInteger(id) >> OS_OBJECT_TYPE_SHIFT);
}
...
uint32 OS_GetMaxForObjectType(osal_objtype_t idtype)
{
    switch (idtype)
    {
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK:
            return OS_MAX_TASKS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_QUEUE:
            return OS_MAX_QUEUES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_BINSEM:
            return OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_COUNTSEM:
            return OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MUTEX:
            return OS_MAX_MUTEXES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM:
            return OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_DIR:
            return OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE:
            return OS_MAX_TIMEBASES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB:
            return OS_MAX_TIMERS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MODULE:
            return OS_MAX_MODULES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_FILESYS:
            return OS_MAX_FILE_SYSTEMS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE:
            return OS_MAX_CONSOLES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR:
            return OS_MAX_CONDVARS;
        default:
            return 0;
    }
}
...
#define OSAL_INDEX_C(X) ((osal_index_t)(X))
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED 0x00
...
#define OS_ERR_INVALID_ID (-16)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
typedef uint32 osal_objtype_t
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef uint32 osal_index_t
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
...
typedef int32_t   int32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Fragments not listed are simple declarations, typedefs and constant macros (e.g. type definitions, numeric constant defines such as OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED, OS_ERR_INVALID_ID, OS_SUCCESS, and the integer typedefs) or trivial single-line definitions that do not affect control-flow reachability. The suspicious fragments selected are those that affect control flow (the pointer-check macro, the ID decomposition calls, the type/ID checks, the call to OS_GetMaxForObjectType and its switch/default behavior, the branch that computes the array index, and the function return). These should be investigated for possible unreachable-code situations (for example, a macro that never returns, an ID encoding that makes certain branches impossible, or an OS_GetMaxForObjectType default that makes a branch always taken). Other code in the provided snippets is not likely to create unreachable code and therefore was not included.
